content.content: As someone who’s invested in Maker but not part of the “organization”, I’d love to see tokenomics, terms and structure which are dead simple and easy to communicate and explain. I think it’s essential for true decentralization and participation. Historically, IMHO, over-complexity and poor naming conventions have plagued Maker. It has been corrected over time. Reading this feels like going back to the days of tub, tap and CDPs. Also, why these numbers? What’s the reasoning for the seemingly arbitrary determined amounts?

We ask for a simple explanation like we were 2nd graders and instead we get hit with “elixirs”, “sub dao incubation”, “Anti-Reflexivity Mechanic” I want to be engaged and follow the endgame, but its complicated to understan these terms when they are articulated in a non simple way.

TRUEMAKER:  I want to be engaged and follow the endgame, but its complicated to understan these terms when they are articulated in a non simple way.   These might be of assistance - a set of simplified Endgame guides drafted by @LongForWisdom  (certain details have changed but they’re still extremely helpful): Endgame Index List

To be clear, I think the problem is the actual complexity of Endgame and the suggested tokenomics and DAO mechanics. It’s not about the materials and explanations, though the efforts there are definitely much appreciated.
